2/7/2025.name: Chinese Lunar New Year Celebration
2/7/2025.description:
Join the  Chinese Club, NCHS,  and  TWCC  on Feb. 7, 2025, to celebrate the Chinese New Year! The event will feature food games, including a passport book to navigate the different game tables.

Admission is free if you bring food for yourself or your family, and for student and parent volunteers. Otherwise, admission is $3 per person and free for children under 5.

 PURCHASE: Tickets via Omella

2/7/2025.name: 2024 Frosh/Soph Play: The Lion, The Witch & The Wardrobe
2/7/2025.description:
This new dramatization of C.S. Lewis' classic, set in the land of Narnia, faithfully recreates the magic and mystery of Aslan, the great lion; his struggle with the White Witch; and the adventures of four children who inadvertently wander from an old wardrobe into the exciting, never-to-be-forgotten Narina. The intense action features chases, duels, and escapes as the witch is determined to keep Narnia in her possession and end Aslan's reign. All the memorable episodes from the story are represented in this exciting dramatization: the temptation of Edmund by the witch, the slaying of the evil wolf by Peter, the witnessing of Aslan's resurrection by Susan and Lucy, the crowning of the four new rulers of Narnia, and more. The supporting characters are also here: the unicorn, the centaur and other forest animals, along with Father Christmas, Mr. and Mrs. Beaver and Tumnus the Faun. This story of love, faith, courage and giving, with its triumph of good over evil, is a true celebration of life.



  Audience Advisory: Patriot Theatre Company rates this production PG. The staging includes moments of combat, flashing lights, and atmospheric fog.  


 LINKS 

 *  PURCHASE: Tickets via GoFan  ( Feb. 7 @ 7 p.m.  |  Feb. 8 @ 2 p.m.  |  Feb. 8 @ 7 p.m. )
*  DOWNLOAD: Event Program

2/11/2025.name: Operation Snowball Fundraiser: Culver's of Lincolnshire
2/11/2025.description:
Join Us for an Operation Snowball Reunion & Fundraiser! Mark your calendars! Operation Snowball is hosting a Reunion & Fundraiser on Tuesday, February 11th at Culver's in Lincolnshire. This is the perfect opportunity to reconnect with friends, share memories, support Snowball while enjoying some delicious food!

A portion of the evening's sales will go directly toward supporting Operation Snowball's mission of empowering students through leadership, personal growth, and positive choices. Bring your family and friends, grab a meal, and help make a difference!

We can't wait to see you there! Spread the word and let's make it a great night!

2/11/2025.name: CCC Presents: Career Talks w/ Jim Kwasek (Pilot & Flight Instructor)
2/11/2025.description:
Join us virtually on February 11th from 6:00pm-7:00 to discover a career in aviation with Jim Kwasek!

During this virtual meeting you will hear Mr. Kwasek's insights on what it's like to be a pilot, the steps to getting started, and the exciting opportunities in aviation! Don't miss this chance to learn from an expert and discover a possible career interest in aviation.

2/13/2025.name: Black History Month at SHS: A Conversation with Michael Wilson
2/13/2025.description: Join the  BSU (Black Student Union)  as Michael Wilson, a former Navy Engineer and a current therapist who mentors students of color, spends the afternoon with our students. He will share how he learned to navigate the military as a person of color, why education is important for people of color, and how he navigated a predominantly white university as a person of color.

2/14/2025.name: CCC Presents: Summer Job Fair
2/14/2025.description:
Mark your calendars for Friday, February 14th, for Stevenson's Summer Job Fair hosted by the College Career Center! This will be held during the lunch periods (4th, 5th, and 6th) in the PWC. During this time, students will have the chance to interact with representatives from local businesses and organizations to learn about what types of summer work opportunities will be available. Freshman through senior students are able to attend this event.

2/25/2025.name: CCC Presents: Career Talks w/ Uline (Careers in Business & E-Commerce Virtual Series)
2/25/2025.description:
Are you a high school student curious about the dynamic world of eCommerce and business? Don't miss the upcoming webinar series where industry experts will dive into the diverse roles within eCommerce and business to share valuable insights on how to land your dream job!

Hear from a seasoned leader, a driven data analyst, an insightful UX researcher, a creative UX designer, and a savvy business analyst who are part of the Uline eCommerce team and serve millions of customers who shop at  Uline.com .


Please email  jtravis@d125.org  with any questions.

 EVENTS 
 * Tuesday, Feb. 25 -- Data Analytics
* Tuesday, Mar. 4 -- UX Research
* Tuesday, Mar. 11 -- UX Design
* Tuesday, Mar. 18 -- Business Analytics
 
 LINKS

* Learn more about the presenters.:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_aQlqaYM-cvEaLyL-...

Join us in room 2104 on Thursday, February 27th at 3:45 PM for a festive celebration filled with delicious food, vibrant music, and unforgettable fun. Don't miss out!

3/4/2025.name: Winter Band Concert
3/4/2025.description:
The Winter Band Concert will feature performances from all six of our curricular bands, offering a comprehensive look at the program's work. The program includes the  Freshman Band ,  Symphonic Band ,  Wind Symphon  y  and the  Wind Ensemble . These bands are directed by Caitlin McGovern, Mark Hiebert, and Ben Voigt. The concert will include a selection of music, from classic band repertoire to contemporary pieces.

This year's concert will also feature a guest performance by the John Hersey Symphonic Band. Additionally, our bands will have the opportunity to work with guest conductor Mr. Jeffrey Spenner from the United States Coast Guard Band.

The Winter Band Concert provides an opportunity to hear the results of the students' hard work and dedication. We invite you to attend and enjoy an evening of music.





 LINKS 


 *  DOWNLOAD: Event Program   
*  Streaming via Vimeo
3/4/2025.location: Stevenson High School | Performing Arts Center

3/5/2025.name: CCC Presents: Career Ready Trade Expo
3/5/2025.description:
Stevenson High School's Career Ready, Trades, and Military Expo will take place on March 5th! This event is a great opportunity for students to explore careers that require little to no postsecondary education. It will be held in the Wood Commons, West Commons, and Upper Forum. During 8th period, the expo will be open to Stevenson students only with 8th period free, and from 4:00pm to 6:30pm, parents and families are welcome to attend.

This expo is designed for students interested in careers that offer on-the-job training, full-time employment opportunities with minimal degree requirements. Industry professionals, trade and apprenticeship programs, and military representatives will be available to discuss various career paths. Community college representatives will also be present to provide information about two-year degree programs.

Please check out the participant list ( drive.google.com/file/d/1OupZekG1bgGBFOrWytwlCe_t6VuDZRlR/view?usp=sharing ) to see which organizations are attending. A detailed event handout, including table locations and additional information, will be provided closer to the date.

If you have any questions, please contact Jaime Travis at  jtravis@d125.org .

3/5/2025.name: Stevenson Family Engagement presents: What To Expect When Your Teen Turns 18
3/5/2025.description:
Many parents find it surprising that their parental rights change when their teen turns 18. During this discussion, Alan Press and Caren Naidoff, attorneys from the Shire Law Group, will discuss how parents can continue to support their teens when they become legal adults.

Due to the popularity of this topic, we will host a small group of in-person audience members who will have an opportunity to interact with Alan and Carin during their presentation. If you would like to attend the discussion at the Stevenson High School district office, please complete this form ( forms.gle/SBy55qCzjszfcCP16 )

Alternately, you are invited to participate in this discussion via Zoom:  zoom.us/j/93571206590

3/5/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: 99% Perspiration: A New Working History of the American Way of Life
3/5/2025.description:
Chandler's book explores what happens when hard work, grit, and ambition isn't enough to become successful. He traveled across the US interviewing teachers, civic leaders, elected offciials, faith leaders, blue collar workers, and entrepreneurs, and reaches the conclusion that it's a myth that success is a matter of individual ingenuity and bootstrapping. Self-reliance is laudable, but not in itself sufficient. Humans are an interdependent, relational species, and achievement has deep roots in connection with others.





 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/99-pers... 

  

  

  







  

  

  

  

  

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/481740339...

3/6/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: Shift: Managing Your Emotions - So They Don't Manage You (Event #1 of 3)
3/6/2025.description:
Kross's research on self control, emotion regulation, and social neuroscience is exemplary. His first bestseller, Chatter, explored the science of introspection, the conversations we have with ourselves, sometimes negative. He is quite skilled interpersonally, is observant, open, and wants to make a chnge in people's lives. We're here for that! Daniel Pink is one of his closest friends, so we're anticipating a robust conversation for this Zoom event.







 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/shift-m... 

  

  

  

  







  

  

  

  

  

  

  






* Register via Zoom:  https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/701740493...

3/7/2025.name: Operation Snowball Fundraiser: Business and Technology Club
2025 Winter Play: The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee
3/7/2025.description:
Step right up to the quirkiest competition in town! The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee is a hilarious musical comedy perfect for audiences of all ages.

Follow an eclectic group of six mid-pubescents as they compete for the ultimate spelling championship. Along the way, they'll share hilarious and touching glimpses into their home lives, tackle outrageous (and possibly made-up) words, and dodge the dreaded "ding" of elimination. With catchy songs, quick-witted humor, and lovable characters, this show guarantees an evening of laughter and fun.

Who will take home the trophy? Who will go home with a juice box? Find out in this unforgettable celebration of awkward adolescence and the unbreakable spirit of competition!

    

  Audience Advisory: Patriot Theatre Company rates this production PG.  

 LINKS 
 *  PURCHASE: Tickets via GoFan  ( Mar. 7 @ 7 p.m.  |  Mar. 8 @ 2 p.m.  |  Mar. 8 @ 7 p.m.  |  Mar. 9 @ 2 p.m. )  
*  DOWNLOAD: Event Program

Step right up to the quirkiest competition in town! The 25th Annual Putnam County Spelling Bee is a hilarious musical comedy perfect for audiences of all ages.

Follow an eclectic group of six mid-pubescents as they compete for the ultimate spelling championship. Along the way, they'll share hilarious and touching glimpses into their home lives, tackle outrageous (and possibly made-up) words, and dodge the dreaded "ding" of elimination. With catchy songs, quick-witted humor, and lovable characters, this show guarantees an evening of laughter and fun.

Who will take home the trophy? Who will go home with a juice box? Find out in this unforgettable celebration of awkward adolescence and the unbreakable spirit of competition!

    

  Audience Advisory: Patriot Theatre Company rates this production PG.  

 LINKS 
 *  PURCHASE: Tickets via GoFan  ( Mar. 7 @ 7 p.m.  |  Mar. 8 @ 2 p.m.  |  Mar. 8 @ 7 p.m.  |  Mar. 9 @ 2 p.m. )  
*  DOWNLOAD: Event Program

3/11/2025.name: CCC Presents: Career Talks w/ Uline (Careers in Business & E-Commerce Virtual Series)
3/11/2025.description:
Are you a high school student curious about the dynamic world of eCommerce and business? Don't miss the upcoming webinar series where industry experts will dive into the diverse roles within eCommerce and business to share valuable insights on how to land your dream job!

Hear from a seasoned leader, a driven data analyst, an insightful UX researcher, a creative UX designer, and a savvy business analyst who are part of the Uline eCommerce team and serve millions of customers who shop at  Uline.com .


Please email  jtravis@d125.org  with any questions.

 EVENTS 
 * Tuesday, Feb. 25 -- Data Analytics
* Tuesday, Mar. 4 -- UX Research
* Tuesday, Mar. 11 -- UX Design
* Tuesday, Mar. 18 -- Business Analytics
 
 LINKS 
 * Please complete this  Google Form  if you are interested in attending.
* Learn more about the presenters.:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1_aQlqaYM-cvEaLyL-...

3/12/2025.description: All meetings begin at 5:30 p.m. in the Athletics Division Office (Room 5116 in PWC)
3/12/2025.location: Stevenson High School | Athletics Division Office (Room 5116 in PWC)

3/12/2025.name: CCC Presents: Sophomore Family College and Career Night
3/12/2025.description:
The College Career Center will hold its annual night for sophomore families at 7 p.m. on Wednesday, March 12th. The event will be in person in the PAC but can also be streamed live via Zoom:  https://zoom.us/j/91630430709 
The slides and recording for this presentation will be available on the CCC website within one week of the event for families unable to attend.

Post Secondary Counselors Sara Hanson and Dan Miller, and Career Exploration Specialist Ms. Jaime Travis will discuss:
 * What families can expect during their junior year as they embark on the college and career exploration process.
* Naviance, an online tool to assist Stevenson students with college planning.
* Career planning options, including internships, job shadowing, and more.
 
Students are strongly encouraged to attend with their parent(s) or guardian(s) and have their iPads ready to explore Naviance during the presentation. 
 Families that would like   to request a copy of the slide deck in another language can reach out to    shs_CollegeCareer@d125.org   , or via phone at  (847) 415-4517  prior to Tuesday, March 4th.  


 We look forward to working with your family!

3/13/2025.name: Stevenson Family Engagement presents: Transition to Young Adulthood:​ Managing Stress and Assessing College Preparedness
3/13/2025.description:
Stevenson Families are invited to attend a webinar presented by Compass Health Center on how families can help their teens make the transition to young adulthood. The objectives for the discussion include:
 * Understand current mental health trends and common stressors as high school seniors transition into adulthood.
* Learn how to evaluate college preparedness and provide effective support that encourages independence without enabling.
* Recognize the concept of learned helplessness and how parents can help their children avoid or overcome it during this critical stage.
   Links 
 * Zoom Link:  d125-org.zoom.us/j/96128832678

3/17/2025.description: Please visit the  Board of Education webpage  for additional information.
3/17/2025.location: District 125 Administration Building, 2 Stevenson Drive, Lincolnshire, IL

3/17/2025.name: Family Action Network presents: Me, But Better: The Science and Promise of Personality Change
3/17/2025.description:
Khazan is a health and science reporter, and her new book documents her year-long experiments into improving her "Big Five" personality traits (neuroticism, conscientiousness, agreeableness, openness to experience, and extroversion). A funny, insightful read. Her interlocutor, Maria Konnikova, is a force, too!







 Links 
 * Event Page:  https://www.familyactionnetwork.net/events/me-but-...

3/20/2025.name: CCC Presents: College and Career Center Night for Junior Families
3/20/2025.description:
All juniors and their parents/guardians are invited to the  College Career Center Series for Junior  Families. Our second night of the series is on Thursday, March 20th from 7 pm - 8 pm in the West Auditorium and streamed via Zoom Webinar:  https://zoom.us/j/93201457327 .

  Students are highly encouraged to attend this program with their families.  
 * Post Secondary Counselors Sara Hanson and Dan Miller will discuss:
* How Colleges Admit Students "Holistic" Admission Process
* Letters of Recommendation Essays
* Admission Plans
* Application Process & Timeline
 
The slides and recording for this presentation will be available on the CCC website within one week of the event for families who are unable to attend.

  Families that would like to request a copy of the slide deck in another language can reach out to    shs_CollegeCareer@d125.org   , or via phone at  (847) 415-4517  prior to     Thursday, March 13th.  

For more information, please visit the  Junior Focus web page .
3/20/2025.location: Stevenson High School | West Auditorium & Virtual Meeting via Zoom

3/21/2025.name: CCC Presents: Career Talks w/ Law Professionals (Judge, Criminal Defense Attorney & Felony Prosecutor)
3/21/2025.description:
If you're a student curious about the field of law, don't miss this opportunity to hear from three distinguished legal professionals with diverse backgrounds in prosecution, defense, and the judiciary. Learn what it takes to navigate the legal field, from the courtroom to the judge's bench.



Please email  jtravis@d125.org  with any questions.







 LINKS

4/22/2025.name: Freshmen Wellness Day
4/22/2025.description:
While all the sophomores are taking their Pre-ACTs, all freshmen will spend a fun-filled day with SHS staff to explore the theme of "Live in Community!" Through a variety of activities, freshmen will grow their skills to:
 * Build character and a sense of confidence while appreciating the similarities and differences of others.
* Listen to others and communicate in ways that build empathy and respect.
* Understand what it means to be an effective ally when people are treated with disrespect or injustice.
* Establish and maintain supportive relationships in ways that foster learning.
4/22/2025.location: Stevenson High School | Patriot Wellness Center
